001package com.github.nradov.abnffuzzer;
002
003import static org.apache.commons.cli.Option.builder;
004
005import java.io.File;
006import java.io.FileOutputStream;
007import java.io.IOException;
008import java.io.InputStream;
009import java.io.InputStreamReader;
010import java.io.OutputStream;
011import java.io.PrintWriter;
012import java.io.Reader;
013import java.io.StringReader;
014import java.net.URI;
015import java.net.URL;
016import java.nio.charset.Charset;
017import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
018import java.util.Arrays;
019import java.util.Collections;
020import java.util.HashMap;
021import java.util.HashSet;
022import java.util.Map;
023import java.util.Random;
024import java.util.Set;
025
026import org.antlr.v4.runtime.ANTLRInputStream;
027import org.antlr.v4.runtime.BaseErrorListener;
028import org.antlr.v4.runtime.CommonTokenStream;
029import org.antlr.v4.runtime.RecognitionException;
030import org.antlr.v4.runtime.Recognizer;
031import org.antlr.v4.runtime.tree.ParseTree;
032import org.antlr.v4.runtime.tree.TerminalNode;
033import org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine;
034import org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLineParser;
035import org.apache.commons.cli.DefaultParser;
036import org.apache.commons.cli.HelpFormatter;
037import org.apache.commons.cli.Options;
038import org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException;
039
040import com.github.nradov.abnffuzzer.antlr4.AbnfLexer;
041import com.github.nradov.abnffuzzer.antlr4.AbnfParser;
042import com.github.nradov.abnffuzzer.antlr4.AbnfParser.ElementsContext;
043import com.github.nradov.abnffuzzer.antlr4.AbnfParser.Rule_Context;
044
045/**
046 * Main class for fuzz testing. Instantiate this class with a set of ABNF rules
047 * and then call one of the {@code generate} methods to create random output
048 * suitable for use in a test. It can't generate anything for
049 * <code>prose-val</code> elements because those aren't formally specified; for
050 * testing purposes you should replace such elements with literal strings in the
051 * ABNF file. Complex ABNF files may require increasing your JVM's stack size;
052 * for Oracle this can be done with the <code>-Xss</code> <i>size</i> <a href=
053 * "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/13/docs/specs/man/java.html#extra-options-for-java"
054 * target="_">option</a>.
055 *
056 * @author Nick Radov
057 */
058public class Fuzzer {
059
060        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
061        private static final long serialVersionUID = -5734957539715862213L;
062
063        private transient Random random;
064
065        /** Map of rule names to their elements. */
066        private final Map<String, Rule> ruleList;
067
068        private static final String LINE_SEPARATOR = System.getProperty("line.separator");
069
070        // Apache Commons CLI help formatter constants
071        private static final String HEADER = "Create random output that matches an "
072                        + "Augmented Backus-Naur Form (as defined in IETF RFC 5234) rule "
073                        + "for use in fuzz testing. By default ABNF rules are read from "
074                        + "stdin and random values matching the specified rule name "
075                        + "are written to stdout. The input must contain only rule " + "definitions.";
076        private static final String FOOTER = "For documentation and details please "
077                        + "visit: <https://github.com/nradov/abnffuzzer>.";
078
079        /**
080         * Short and long command line option names for use with Commons CLI.
081         */
082        private static enum OptionName {
083                Count("n", "count"), Separator("s", "separator"), Input("i", "input"), Output("o", "output"),
084                Charset("c", "charset"), Exclude("e", "exclude"), Help("?", "help");
085
086                final String opt;
087                final String longOpt;
088
089                OptionName(final String opt, final String longOpt) {
090                        this.opt = opt;
091                        this.longOpt = longOpt;
092                }
093        }
094
095        /**
096         * Parse a set of ABNF rules and generate one or more matching random values. By
097         * default it reads the rules from {@code stdin} and writes one value to
098         * {@code stdout}. Command-line parameters can be used to read from and write to
099         * files, and to generate multiple values.
100         *
101         * @param args command line arguments
102         * @throws ParseException if the command line can't be parsed
103         * @throws IOException    if an error occurs reading the input or writing the
104         *                        output
105         */
106        public static void main(final String[] args) throws ParseException, IOException {
107                final Options options = new Options();
108                addOptions(options);
109                final CommandLineParser parser = new DefaultParser();
110                final CommandLine cmd = parser.parse(options, args);
111
112                if (cmd.hasOption(OptionName.Help.opt)) {
113                        final HelpFormatter formatter = new HelpFormatter();
114                        formatter.printHelp(Fuzzer.class.getSimpleName(), HEADER, options, FOOTER, true);
115                        return;
116                }
117
118                if (cmd.getArgList().size() != 1) {
119                        System.err.println("must specify 1 rule name");
120                        return;
121                }
122
123                final int count;
124                if (cmd.hasOption(OptionName.Count.opt)) {
125                        count = Integer.parseInt(cmd.getOptionValue(OptionName.Count.opt));
126                        if (count < 1) {
127                                System.err.println(OptionName.Count.longOpt + " must be >= 1");
128                                return;
129                        }
130                } else {
131                        count = 1;
132                }
133
134                final String separator = cmd.hasOption(OptionName.Separator.opt) ? cmd.getOptionValue(OptionName.Separator.opt)
135                                : LINE_SEPARATOR;
136
137                final Charset charset = cmd.hasOption(OptionName.Charset.opt)
138                                ? Charset.forName(cmd.getOptionValue(OptionName.Charset.opt))
139                                : null;
140
141                final Set<String> exclude;
142                if (cmd.hasOption(OptionName.Exclude.opt)) {
143                        exclude = new HashSet<>();
144                        exclude.addAll(Arrays.asList(cmd.getOptionValues(OptionName.Exclude.opt)));
145                } else {
146                        exclude = Collections.emptySet();
147                }
148                try (final OutputStream out = cmd.hasOption(OptionName.Output.opt)
149                                ? new FileOutputStream(new File(cmd.getOptionValue(OptionName.Output.opt)))
150                                : System.out) {
151                        final Fuzzer f;
152                        if (cmd.hasOption(OptionName.Input.opt)) {
153                                f = new Fuzzer(new File(cmd.getOptionValue(OptionName.Input.opt)));
154                        } else {
155                                f = new Fuzzer(System.in);
156                        }
157
158                        final String ruleName = cmd.getArgList().get(0);
159
160                        final PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(out);
161                        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
162                                if (i > 0) {
163                                        pw.write(separator);
164                                }
165                                if (charset == null) {
166                                        out.write(f.generate(ruleName, exclude));
167                                } else {
168                                        pw.write(f.generate(ruleName, exclude, charset));
169                                }
170                        }
171                        pw.flush();
172                        out.flush();
173                }
174        }
175
176        private static void addOptions(final Options options) {
177                options.addOption(builder(OptionName.Count.opt).longOpt(OptionName.Count.longOpt).hasArg().argName("number")
178                                .valueSeparator().type(Integer.class).desc("number of random values to generate (default to 1)")
179                                .build());
180                options.addOption(builder(OptionName.Separator.opt).longOpt(OptionName.Separator.longOpt).valueSeparator()
181                                .hasArg().valueSeparator().type(String.class)
182                                .desc("string inserted between output values (default to the \"line.separator\" property)").build());
183                options.addOption(builder(OptionName.Input.opt).longOpt(OptionName.Input.longOpt).valueSeparator().hasArg()
184                                .argName("path").type(String.class).desc("input file path").build());
185                options.addOption(builder(OptionName.Output.opt).longOpt(OptionName.Output.longOpt).valueSeparator().hasArg()
186                                .argName("path").type(String.class).desc("output file path").build());
187                options.addOption(builder(OptionName.Charset.opt).longOpt(OptionName.Charset.longOpt).hasArg().valueSeparator()
188                                .type(String.class).desc("name of one of the standard Java character sets;"
189                                                + " if this option isn't specified then the output will be raw bytes")
190                                .build());
191                options.addOption(builder(OptionName.Exclude.opt).longOpt(OptionName.Exclude.longOpt).hasArgs().valueSeparator()
192                                .desc("comma-separated list of names of an ABNF rules to exclude when generating the values").build());
193                options.addOption(
194                                builder(OptionName.Help.opt).longOpt(OptionName.Help.longOpt).desc("print this message").build());
195        }
196
197        /**
198         * Create a new {@code Fuzzer} by reading ABNF rules from a URL.
199         *
200         * @param url location of ANBF rules
201         * @throws IOException if the rules can't be read from the URL
202         */
203        public Fuzzer(final URL url) throws IOException {
204                this(new InputStreamHolder(url));
205        }
206
207        private Fuzzer(final InputStreamHolder ish) throws IOException {
208                this(ish.is);
209                // prevent resource leakage
210                ish.is.close();
211        }
212
213        private static class InputStreamHolder {
214
215                final InputStream is;
216
217                InputStreamHolder(final URL url) throws IOException {
218                        is = url.openStream();
219                }
220        }
221
222        /**
223         * Create a new {@code Fuzzer} by reading ABNF rules from a URI.
224         *
225         * @param uri location of ANBF rules
226         * @throws IOException if the rules can't be read from the URI
227         */
228        public Fuzzer(final URI uri) throws IOException {
229                this(uri.toURL());
230        }
231
232        /**
233         * Create a new {@code Fuzzer} by reading ABNF rules from a file.
234         *
235         * @param file location of ANBF rules
236         * @throws IOException if the rules can't be read from the file
237         */
238        public Fuzzer(final File file) throws IOException {
239                this(file.toURI());
240        }
241
242        /**
243         * Create a new {@code Fuzzer} by reading ABNF rules from a stream.
244         *
245         * @param is ANBF rules
246         * @throws IOException if the rules can't be read from the stream
247         */
248        public Fuzzer(final InputStream is) throws IOException {
249                this(new InputStreamReader(is));
250        }
251
252        /**
253         * Create a new {@code Fuzzer} by reading ABNF rules from a string.
254         *
255         * @param rules ANBF rules
256         * @throws IOException if the rules can't be read
257         */
258        public Fuzzer(final String rules) throws IOException {
259                this(new StringReader(rules));
260        }
261
262        /**
263         * Create a new {@code Fuzzer} by reading ABNF rules from a reader.
264         *
265         * @param rules ANBF rules
266         * @throws IOException if the rules can't be read
267         */
268        @SuppressWarnings("serial")
269        public Fuzzer(final Reader rules) throws IOException {
270                final AbnfLexer l = new AbnfLexer(new ANTLRInputStream(rules));
271                final CommonTokenStream tokens = new CommonTokenStream(l);
272                final AbnfParser p = new AbnfParser(tokens);
273                p.setBuildParseTree(true);
274                p.addErrorListener(new BaseErrorListener() {
275                        @Override
276                        public void syntaxError(final Recognizer<?, ?> recognizer, final Object offendingSymbol, final int line,
277                                        final int charPositionInLine, final String msg, final RecognitionException e) {
278                                throw new IllegalStateException("failed to parse at line " + line + " due to " + msg, e);
279                        }
280                });
281
282                final ParseTree tree = p.rulelist();
283                ruleList = Collections.unmodifiableMap(new RuleList() {
284                        {
285                                for (int i = 0; i < tree.getChildCount(); i++) {
286                                        final ParseTree child = tree.getChild(i);
287                                        if (child instanceof Rule_Context && child.getChildCount() == 3) {
288                                                // rule definition
289                                                final ParseTree name = child.getChild(0);
290                                                if (!(name instanceof TerminalNode)) {
291                                                        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
292                                                }
293                                                final ParseTree equalSign = child.getChild(1);
294                                                if (!(equalSign instanceof TerminalNode) || !"=".equals(equalSign.toString())) {
295                                                        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
296                                                }
297                                                final ParseTree elements = child.getChild(2);
298                                                if (!(elements instanceof ElementsContext)) {
299                                                        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
300                                                }
301
302                                                put(name.toString(), new Rule((ElementsContext) elements));
303                                        }
304                                }
305                        }
306                });
307        }
308
309        /**
310         * Generate a random sequence of bytes which matches a named ABNF rule. The
311         * output will be suitable for use in a fuzz test.
312         *
313         * @param ruleName ABNF rule name
314         * @return random sequence which matches the specified rule
315         * @throws IOException              shouldn't happen
316         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code ruleName} doesn't exist
317         * @throws IllegalStateException    if any defined rule references another rule
318         *                                  which doesn't exist
319         * @see #generate(String, Set)
320         */
321        public byte[] generate(final String ruleName) throws IOException {
322                return generate(ruleName, Collections.<String>emptySet());
323        }
324
325        /**
326         * Generate a random sequence of characters which matches a named ABNF rule. The
327         * output will be suitable for use in a fuzz test.
328         *
329         * @param ruleName ABNF rule name
330         * @param exclude  ABNF rule names to exclude during alternative selection; this
331         *                 allows for testing code that implements only a subset of an
332         *                 RFC
333         * @return random sequence of characters which matches the specified rule
334         *         encoded in the US_ASCII character set
335         * @throws IOException              shouldn't happen
336         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code ruleName} doesn't exist
337         * @throws IllegalStateException    if any defined rule references another rule
338         *                                  which doesn't exist
339         */
340        public String generateAscii(final String ruleName, final Set<String> exclude) throws IOException {
341                return generate(ruleName, exclude, StandardCharsets.US_ASCII);
342        }
343
344        /**
345         * Generate a random sequence of characters which matches a named ABNF rule. The
346         * output will be suitable for use in a fuzz test.
347         *
348         * @param ruleName ABNF rule name
349         * @return random sequence of characters which matches the specified rule
350         *         encoded in the US_ASCII character set
351         * @throws IOException              shouldn't happen
352         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code ruleName} doesn't exist
353         * @throws IllegalStateException    if any defined rule references another rule
354         *                                  which doesn't exist
355         */
356        public String generateAscii(final String ruleName) throws IOException {
357                return generateAscii(ruleName, Collections.<String>emptySet());
358        }
359
360        /**
361         * Generate a random sequence of bytes which matches a named ABNF rule. The
362         * output will be suitable for use in a fuzz test.
363         *
364         * @param ruleName ABNF rule name
365         * @param exclude  rule names to exclude when generating output
366         * @return random sequence of bytes which matches the specified rule
367         * @throws IOException              shouldn't happen
368         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code ruleName} doesn't exist
369         * @throws IllegalStateException    if any defined rule references another rule
370         *                                  which doesn't exist
371         */
372        public byte[] generate(final String ruleName, final Set<String> exclude) throws IOException {
373                return getRule(ruleName).generate(this, getRandom(), exclude);
374        }
375
376        /**
377         * Generate a random sequence of characters which matches a named ABNF rule. The
378         * output will be suitable for use in a fuzz test.
379         *
380         * @param ruleName ABNF rule name
381         * @param exclude  rule names to exclude when generating output
382         * @param charset  encoding for the return value
383         * @return random sequence of characters which matches the specified rule
384         *         encoded in the specified character set
385         * @throws IOException              shouldn't happen
386         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code ruleName} doesn't exist
387         * @throws IllegalStateException    if any defined rule references another rule
388         *                                  which doesn't exist
389         */
390        public String generate(final String ruleName, final Set<String> exclude, final Charset charset) throws IOException {
391                return new String(generate(ruleName, exclude), charset);
392        }
393
394        // built in rules
395
396        @SuppressWarnings("serial")
397        private static final Map<String, Rule> BUILT_IN_RULES = Collections.unmodifiableMap(new HashMap<String, Rule>() {
398                {
399                        put("ALPHA", new Alpha());
400                        put("BIT", new Bit());
401                        put("CHAR", new Char());
402                        put("CR", new Cr());
403                        put("CRLF", new CrLf());
404                        put("CTL", new Ctl());
405                        put("DIGIT", new Digit());
406                        put("DQUOTE", new Dquote());
407                        put("HEXDIG", new Hexdig());
408                        put("HTAB", new Htab());
409                        put("LF", new Lf());
410                        put("LWSP", new Lwsp());
411                        put("OCTET", new Octet());
412                        put("SP", new Sp());
413                        put("VCHAR", new Vchar());
414                        put("WSP", new Wsp());
415                }
416        });
417
418        /**
419         * Get a defined ABNF rule.
420         *
421         * @param ruleName rule name (could be one of the core rules defined in RFC
422         *                 5234)
423         * @return the rule
424         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the rule name isn't defined
425         */
426        Rule getRule(final String ruleName) {
427                if (BUILT_IN_RULES.containsKey(ruleName)) {
428                        return BUILT_IN_RULES.get(ruleName);
429                } else if (ruleList.containsKey(ruleName)) {
430                        return ruleList.get(ruleName);
431                }
432                throw new IllegalArgumentException("no rule \"" + ruleName + "\"");
433        }
434
435        /**
436         * Get the random number generator used to pick between options and
437         * alternatives.
438         *
439         * @return random number generator
440         * @see #setRandom(Random)
441         */
442        public Random getRandom() {
443                if (random == null) {
444                        random = new Random();
445                }
446                return random;
447        }
448
449        /**
450         * Set the random number generator used to pick between alternatives. If this
451         * isn't set then a default implementation will be used.
452         *
453         * @param r random number generator
454         * @see #getRandom()
455         */
456        public void setRandom(final Random r) {
457                if (r == null) {
458                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("null");
459                }
460                random = r;
461        }
462
463}
